intro: Phyllodesmis coriacea, commonly known as the rough phyllodesmis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its leathery, woody phyllodes, which are modified leaves that function as stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a range of colors from white to pink. Phyllodesmis coriacea is often found in open woodlands and is known for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
